topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Protecting Images

body.p: A virtual machine image is a single file that contains a virtual disk with a bootable operating system installed on it. You can use images to create virtual machine instances within the cloud.
If you want to prevent an image from being deleted, you can make that image protected.

section.title: Protect an image

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Compute panel, then the Volumes tab.
The available images are listed.
In the Images screen, for the image you want to protect, click Edit Image, then Edit.
In the Update Image screen, select Protected.

section.p: The image is protected and the Delete Image command is removed from the More menu.
